title: Second Trump-Biden debate canceled after US President declines virtual alternative
description: The Commission on Presidential Debates on Friday canceled the second debate between Donald Trump and Joe Biden after the President declined to do a virtual debate despite concerns over his Covid-19 diagnosis, organizers said.

title: As Covid surges in Europe, these spots are 'obvious candidates' for closures
Listen to the Trump campaign's training tapes for poll watchers
description: After President Trump made claims that some experts worry will lead to voter intimidation, the President's campaign released training material for poll watchers.

title: Anderson Cooper asks for advice after his 'cringeworthy' dance with Madonna
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper shares a video of himself dancing on stage at a Madonna concert with music legend George Clinton. Watch "Full Circle" every Monday, Tuesday and Friday at 6p E.T.

title: Opinion: George W. Bush may be the Republican to help defeat Trump
description:
• Commission cancels second debate between Trump and Biden
• Trump credits swift treatment for his Covid-19 recovery

title: 'This is unbelievable': Watch WFP chief's reaction to winning Nobel Peace Prize
description: The UN's World Food Programme has been awarded the 2020 Nobel Peace Prize. Executive director David Beasley called it "the most exciting point in time in his life."

title: See mother's emotional reunion with son after captivity
description: French aid worker Sophie Pétronin has finally been reunited with her son after being held hostage by Islamist extremists for 1,381 days.

title: Sex scandal renews GOP hopes of keeping Senate majority
description: President Donald Trump's eroded political standing has hurt GOP senators in crucial races across the country, but Republicans now hope a sex scandal in North Carolina will help them fend off the Trump effect in a race that's central to holding the Senate majority.

title: New fears over Trump's health as he gets increasingly desperate
description: President Donald Trump's increasing political desperation is raising concerns about his judgment following his aggressive Covid-19 treatment and as suspicion mounts that the White House is not telling the truth about his health.

title: White House official won't say when Trump last tested negative
description: CNN's Brianna Keilar shares a clip from MSNBC in which White House deputy press secretary Brian Morgenstern, when asked six times, won't reveal the last time President Donald Trump tested negative for Covid-19. Dr. Chris Pernell, who lost her father to coronavirus, reacts.

title: October 10 was supposed to be a major celebration for Kim Jong Un. Instead he faces his most daunting challenges to date
description: When the world's youngest dictator addressed his 25 million or so people on May 7, 2016, he made a bold promise.

title: The US military is trialing augmented reality goggles for dogs
description: Dogs working in the United States military could in the future wear augmented reality (AR) goggles that enable soldiers to give them remote commands during operations.

title: Harry and Meghan receive apology for alleged drone photos of baby Archie
description: Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex have received an apology from a photo agency that allegedly used drones to take pictures of their son, Archie, a lawyer for the couple has said.

title: Up to 1,500 birds may have flown into Philadelphia skyscrapers -- in a single day
description: The only word Stephen Maciejewski can use to describe the event is traumatic.

title: Diabetes drug recalled containing cancer-causing agent
description: A widely-used diabetes drug has been recalled after manufacturers found it contained unacceptably high levels of a cancer-causing contaminant.

title: Dr. Gupta discusses Trump's coughing on Fox News
description: Just over a week after President Trump announced he tested positive for coronavirus, he called into Sean Hannity's show on Fox News saying he felt great and hoped to have a rally this weekend. At least twice during the interview, Trump had to pause his sentences and audibly clear his throat and cough.

title: World Food Programme wins Nobel Peace Prize for fight against 'hunger as a weapon of war'
Named as one of Asia's most influential women for changing lives in Pakistan
description: In a remote village in Pakistan's Chitral Valley, about 1500 meters above sea level, wi-fi is intermittent. It is among these mountains bordering Afghanistan that Karishma Ali is changing lives -- and trying to tell her story despite technological difficulties.

title: Tracking the stimulus failure: Months and months without help
description: Republicans and Democrats have been at odds for months over additional spending to help Americans in the wake of the steepest recession on record. The lack of additional stimulus has big consequences for the country's future.

title: Bars and pubs are closing as Europe battles coronavirus surge. Experts question if it will work
description: With Europe now reporting more coronavirus cases than the United States, Brazil and India, according to World Health Organization figures, many governments are closing down pubs and bars or limiting their opening hours in the hope of avoiding wider lockdowns.

title: It was created as an experiment. Now the World Food Programme sends food to tens of millions of people every year
description: The World Food Programme, which won the 2020 Nobel Peace Prize on Friday, delivered food to 97 million people last year.

title: World Food Programme wins Nobel Peace Prize for fight against 'hunger as a weapon of war'
description: This year's Nobel Peace Prize has been awarded to the World Food Programme (WFP) for its "efforts to combat hunger" and its "contribution to bettering conditions for peace in conflict-affected areas."

title: The one issue that could decide the US election
description: History suggests that in election years with one big issue (that isn't the economy), voters will elect the person they trust most to handle it. CNN's Harry Enten explains how the Covid-19 pandemic may influence the 2020 presidential election.

title: Trump is getting increasingly desperate, sparking new fears for his health
Woman dies after her hair became trapped in a go-kart wheel
description: A 21-year-old woman has died in southern India after her hair got caught in the wheel of a go-kart she was driving, police in the city of Meerpet, Telangana state, told CNN.

title: How a world-famous Congolese style tradition is changing with the times
description: Between 2017 and 2019, I traveled to Brazzaville in the Republic of the Congo and Kinshasa in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) to meet whole families of sapeurs, including female "sapeuses" and mini "sapes" in training.

title: England rugby bosses won't ban slave-era song; will educate fans on its history
description: England's Rugby Football Union (RFU) has decided not to ban fans from chanting a slave-era song -- "Swing Low, Sweet Chariot" -- during matches but will "proactively educate" on its history.

title: Selena Gomez: How beauty can influence our mental health
description: We are constantly bombarded with images and social media posts that make people feel like they need to achieve perfection, which is unattainable. I have been open about my own personal mental health struggles and how I have felt "less than."

title: Facebook can't catch misinformation it's already identified as false, activist group says
description: With less than four weeks to go before a pivotal US election, Facebook has sought to reassure the public it has learned from its 2016 mistakes. On Wednesday, the company rolled out a new policy against voter intimidation and announced it will temporarily suspend political ads after polls close on Election Day.

title: What to say to women going through miscarriage and baby loss
description: On a cold day in March 2019, I locked myself on the roof of my New York City apartment building with a bottle of wine and a pack of ancient cigarettes I hadn't smoked in years. I was determined to take what little pleasure could be gained by privately unraveling outside in very public air.

title: World's longest pedestrian suspension bridge is opening in Portugal
description: It takes about 10 minutes to cross if you're taking in the panoramic views of the waterfall, the gorge, and the fast-moving river seen through the open grid beneath your feet.

title: The UK recovery is slowing. That could mean a very hard winter
description: UK economic growth slowed in August despite an easing of lockdown restrictions and government subsidies for dining in restaurants, suggesting that Britain's recovery was stalling even before a second wave of coronavirus arrived.

title: The naturist couple who travels the world naked
description: At the beginning of the coronavirus pandemic, Nick and Lins De Corte were stuck in Mexico, unable to get flights back to Europe as borders closed and travel restrictions heightened.

title: Analysis: Coughing Trump tells Hannity he's healthy
description: Recuperating from the coronavirus and plunging in the polls, President Trump is retreating to his safe spaces: Twitter, Fox, and rallies.

title: Michigan Governor rips Trump campaign for attacks after alleged kidnapping plot revealed
Surfer missing after another suspected shark attack in Western Australia
description: A surfer is missing after a suspected shark attack along the south coast of Western Australia, authorities said Friday -- the latest incident in a year that has already seen six people killed by the ocean predators across the country.

title: The UK is seeing a surge of mental health issues. This 23-year-old shares her story
description: Whilst lockdowns and social isolation help to curb the spread of coronavirus, it can have a severe impact on people's mental health when their support systems are suddenly cut off. CNN's Isa Soares reports. If you or someone you know is experiencing mental health difficulties, a worldwide directory of resources and international hotlines is provided by the International Association for Suicide Prevention. You can also turn to Befrienders Worldwide.

title: The US is reporting more than 45,000 positive Covid-19 tests on average every day
description: The US is averaging more than 45,000 new Covid-19 positive tests each day -- up 8% from the previous week and more than double what the country was seeing in June, as lockdown restrictions were easing.

title: Hong Kong government accused of colluding with China to surveil and catch fugitives fleeing for Taiwan
description: When 12 Hong Kongers boarded a speedboat in the tiny fishing village of Po Toi O on August 23, they didn't realize they were headed for a world of trouble.

title: Iran's legendary classical singer and composer Mohammad-Reza Shajarian dies
description: Iranians around the world flooded their social media accounts with tributes, songs and poetry dedicated to legendary Iranian singer and composer Mohammad-Reza Shajarian, who died from complications due to a long standing battle with kidney cancer on Thursday.

title: Japanese theme park lets you co-work from the Ferris wheel
description: Yomiuriland, a theme park in the western Tokyo suburbs, is getting creative during the tourism industry free-fall by selling day passes to people looking for a more interesting place to work remotely.

title: Dozens hospitalized after fire engulfs 33-story apartment building in South Korea
description: Dozens were hospitalized in the South Korean city of Ulsan, after a fire engulfed multiple floors of an apartment building late Thursday night.

title: The dark truth behind the million-dollar 'black gold' business
description: In July 2020, US authorities seized 13 tons of human hair imported from Xinjiang, China, and alleged the products were made with forced labor. CNN's Ivan Watson traces the supply chain of the multimillion-dollar hair business in the US and uncovers the dark truth behind it.

title: Michigan man receives 13 stitches after slicing his hand on razor blades attached to a Trump-Pence sign
description: A Michigan man had his hand sliced open on Wednesday by razor blades found on a Trump-Pence 2020 sign that he was trying to remove.

title: Rapper Tory Lanez charged in shooting of Megan Thee Stallion
description: Canadian rapper and singer Tory Lanez was charged Thursday with shooting Megan Thee Stallion, Los Angeles County prosecutors said.

title: Nurse who has seen 'hundreds of people suffocating to death' moved to tears after Trump downplayed coronavirus
description: One nurse has a message for President Donald Trump: The coronavirus pandemic is still something people should care about.

title: With a virtual debate America would win and Trump would lose
description: The President of the United States is scared, and it's starting to show. Donald Trump has tested positive for Covid-19, as have more than a dozen people close to him, including several sitting senators, members of his debate prep team, several members of his staff, his campaign manager and his own wife, first lady Melania Trump. The organizers of his next debate with Democratic nominee Joe Biden, which was scheduled for Thursday of next week, wisely announced a plan to move the debate to an online format. After all, who in their right mind would put a coronavirus patient in an enclosed room with other people, including vulnerable American voters and at least one other senior citizen, for at least 90 minutes of yelling and spewing?

title: Whitmer rips Trump campaign for attacking her after alleged kidnapping plot revealed
description:
• 13 charged in plot to kidnap Michigan governor
• Watch: Whitmer responds to criticism from Trump campaign adviser

title: Fox News viewers use fewer Covid-19 safety precautions than CNN viewers, study finds
description: Viewers who trust Fox News coverage more than CNN's are slightly less likely to take preventative measures against the novel coronavirus and a little more likely to put themselves at risk, according to a new study published Thursday in the journal BMJ Global Health.

title: Internet goes crazy for the fly on Pence's head
description: The best merchandise, memes and remixes featuring the now-famous fly that buzzed on Vice President Mike Pence during the debate against Kamala Harris. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports on fly-mania.

title: Biden says he'll answer court-packing question 'when the election is over'
description: Democratic presidential nominee Joe Biden again ducked questions Thursday about whether he would seek to add seats to the Supreme Court, telling reporters he would not address the issue until after the November 3 election.
